Subject: Re: [junit] Implementing JUnit AFTER development has started...

From: balakrishnan sengodan <bsengodan@...>

Hi David:
For old classes, you must be having testcase file.
Write a java class builder which will read the test
case file and class to be tested and create java class
for JUnit to test the class. Once you are done, then
execute the builder in loop to create java class for
all the classes in the folder. Then you have to
customize it while you are testing the individual
class. 
--- "David M. Goudreau"
<david_goudreau@...> wrote:
> Does anyone have any opinions, suggestions or
> approaches as to how to best
> implement JUnit AFTER development has started?  We
> have a significant code
> base already and we're trying to move to JUnit. 
> What issues did you have
> when trying this yourself?  Was your testing
> hierarchy exactly the same as
> your application package structure?  Did you start
> only using JUnit with new
> development or with bugs as well?  Or did you take a
> month off and have
> everyone write JUnit tests?  Any help would be
> greatly appreciated.
> 
> 
> -dmg
> 
>
